think_procedure.step2: Understand the normal operation of 'max_worker_processes', which is to set the maximum number of background worker processes that the system can support.
think_procedure.step3: Check if 'max_worker_processes' has any special values that alter its normal operation significantly.
think_procedure.step4: Determine if setting 'max_worker_processes' to a specific value (e.g., 0) disables the feature or changes its behavior in a way that is not part of its natural numerical order.
think_procedure.step5: Conclude whether 'max_worker_processes' is a 'special knob' based on the presence of such special values.
